The object of the game is to place more spins than your competitor.
The object of the game is to place more spins than your competitor.

The game consists of spins and bonds. Sites are the yellow circles where a white or black spin can be placed. Links are the yellow lines between the sites. Red and blue bonds can be placed on the links.

The game is played with two players. One player selects to be white and the other player selects to be black. The white player starts the game. A player can make three moves during their turn. They can place a spin on a unoccupied site or place a bond on an unoccupied link. Any combination (up to three) of spins or bonds is allowed. The player can flip spins to their color anytime during their turn. Flipping a spin is only allowed when the energy of the spin is zero or higher. The player\'s turn is finished when they place the third spin or bond.
The game is finished when all of the sites have spins and all of the links have bonds assigned to them. The player with the most spins wins.
